reCaptcha uses an advanced risk analysis: reCaptcha uses an advanced risk analysis engine and adaptive challenges to keep malicious software from engaging in abusive activities on your website. Meanwhile, legitimate users will be able to login, make purchases, view pages, or create accounts and fake users or bots will be blocked.
Search engine optimization is the proces: Search engine optimization is the process of improving the quality and quantity of website traffic to a website or a web page from search engines.
The Open Graph protocol is a markup that: The Open Graph protocol is a markup that determines the type of link to a site in social networks and instant messengers. Thanks to this micro-markup, the correct image and the specified text with a brief description are added to the post, which makes the post look more attractive, it becomes like an ad in contextual advertising and gets more attention. Such a kind of banner significantly increases the click-through rate and the number of reposts.
Facebook Login allows visitors to use th: Facebook Login allows visitors to use their Facebook profile to log into your website instead of creating a unique sign-in.
Get users into your website quickly and: Get users into your website quickly and securely, using a registration system they already use and trust; their Google account.
Additional supported file storage servic: Additional supported file storage services - AWS S3, Wasabi, Digital Ocean Spaces. By default used local file storage.

The SEO Title is used in place of your T: The SEO Title is used in place of your Title on search engine results pages, such as a Google search. SEO titles between 40 and 50 characters with commonly searched words have the best click-through-rates.
The SEO Description is used in place of: The SEO Description is used in place of your Description on search engine results pages. Good SEO descriptions are between 140-156 characters long.
The :attribute dimensions cannot be less: The :attribute dimensions cannot be less than (:min_width px by width) - (:min_height px by height) and cannot be above (:max_width px by width) - (:max_height px by height)
